How to Install wgerman-medical on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • wgerman-medical

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install wgerman-medical on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing wgerman-medical on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall wgerman-medical in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install wgerman-medical, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install wgerman-medical Using apt

To install wgerman-medical in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install wgerman-medical using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install wgerman-medical

The installation of wgerman-medical might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install wgerman-medical Using apt-get

To install wgerman-medical using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install wgerman-medical.

sudo apt-get -y install wgerman-medical

Install wgerman-medical Using Synaptic

To install wgerman-medical using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install wgerman-medical on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for wgerman-medical. This will display the wgerman-medical package in the package window, now to install wgerman-medical, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the wgerman-medical package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of wgerman-medical.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install wgerman-medical Using aptitude

To install wgerman-medical on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of wgerman-medical.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install wgerman-medical using the command aptitude install wgerman-medical.

sudo aptitude -y install wgerman-medical

How to Upgrade wgerman-medical on debian

If you want to upgrade the wgerman-medical package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade wgerman-medical using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade wgerman-medical to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade wgerman-medical.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade wgerman-medical sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade wgerman-medical

Upgrade wgerman-medical using Aptitude

To upgrade wgerman-medical using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade wgerman-medical.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade wgerman-medical

Upgrade wgerman-medical using Synaptic

To upgrade wgerman-medical using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for wgerman-medical, now right-click wgerman-medical, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade wgerman-medical just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall wgerman-medical on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall wgerman-medical from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just wgerman-medical, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove wgerman-medical

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of wgerman-medical

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of wgerman-medical you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge wgerman-medical

Remove wgerman-medical using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall wgerman-medical using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for wgerman-medical, right-click the wgerman-medical package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall wgerman-medical click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install wgerman-medical on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade wgerman-medical using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of wgerman-medical then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
